title: History of Music in Western Culture III
description: Third part of intensive historical, analytical, and cultural-aesthetic examination of music in Western culture from the ninth through the twenty-first centuries. Considers both established traditions and new trends, from Romanticism through Modernism and Postmodernism, c. 1890–present. Prerequisites: MUS 120B. Music majors should be enrolled concurrently in MUS 101C. Department stamp required for nonmajors.
